gensokyo Package¶

gensokyo Package¶

Pyglet-based 2D game engine/wrapper

gensokyo is designed for TouhouS, a Touhou-like shoot-em-up. It provides a basic game engine structure and some commonly used objects, such as Rects, Circles, Vectors.

gensokyo primarily uses MVC and a Component/System based design pattern.

Design Hierarchy¶

component Module¶

This module contains the components provided by gensokyo.

In a component/system design, components hold only data. Systems operate on entites which own components, and thus all logic are in systems.

class gensokyo.component.Component¶

Bases: builtins.object

Abstract Base Class for components

Please subclass to avoid confusion

class gensokyo.component.Velocity¶

Bases: gensokyo.component.Component

Velocity Physics component. It contains a list whose index is the degree of the differential, i.e. 0 is velocity, 1 is acceleration, etc., and value is the corresponding Vector.

add(vector)¶

entity Module¶

class gensokyo.entity.Entity¶

Bases: builtins.object

An entity represents a game object and contains components which encapsulate certain data. An entity should only have one component per superclass, e.g., it should have either an A component or an ASubclass component, not both. However, it may be useful to make Interface superclasses.

add(component)¶
delete(component)¶
get(types)¶

If types is a single type, return a tuple of components who are an instance of type or a subclass of type. If types is a list of types, return a tuple of all components of the given types with the following format:

(
    (components where isinstance(component, types[0])),
    (components where isinstance(component, types[1])),
    .
    .
)

Some tuples may be empty if the entity does not have those components.

system Module¶

class gensokyo.system.CollisionSystem¶

Bases: gensokyo.system.System

static collide(hb1, hb2)¶
Parameters:
  • t1 (tuple) – hitboxes to compare
  • t2 (tuple) – hitboxes to compare
Return type:

boolean
req_components = (<class 'gensokyo.component.Hitbox'>,)¶
update(dt)¶

Compare ALL of the hitboxes of entities with a hitbox component. If any of them collide, have the SystemManager dispatch on_collide event with a tuple containing the two entities as an argument.

class gensokyo.system.PhysicsSystem¶

Bases: gensokyo.system.System

req_components = (<class 'gensokyo.component.Velocity'>, <class 'gensokyo.component.Position'>)¶
update(dt)¶

For all entities with Velocity and Position components, PhysicsSystem applies ALL velocities to ALL positions
